comment.body: JEAF Mail Service Provider is responsible for creating and sending e-mail messages using the Java Mail API. JEAF provides the possibility to use the Mail Service Provider not only in a JSE, but also in an EJBContainer Runtime Environment. The configuration for the mail session in a JSE Runtime Environment is stored in a properties file. Nearly all the necessary adjustments to the configuration for the mail session in an EJBContainer Runtime Environment should be made inside the configuration of the Application Server. Only the Java Mail session binding JNDI path has to be set inside the properties file in order to get the mail session from the Application Server.
